'''Cameron Thomas Duddy''' (born December 6, 1985) is an American [[music video]] director and musician with over 9 billion views across his work.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Dagger |first=Stag & |date=2022-09-03 |title=What Is The Most Viewed Music Video On Youtube |url=https://www.staganddagger.co.uk/what-is-the-most-viewed-music-video-on-youtube/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=Stag And Dagger |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2019-11-06 |title=The 20 Best Music Videos Of The 2010s |url=https://www.stereogum.com/2063870/the-20-best-music-videos-of-the-2010s/lists/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=Stereogum |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite magazine |last=Mamo |first=Heran |date=2021-08-25 |title=They're 'Worth It': Fifth Harmony Scores a Second Music Video With 2 Billion YouTube Views |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/fifth-harmony-worth-it-music-video-2-billion-views-9619891/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}}</ref> As a director, he is known for his work with [[Bruno Mars]], [[OneRepublic]], and [[Fifth Harmony]]. Most notably, Cameron directed the video for "Uptown Funk", winning an EMA, VMA, and topping charts as the 3rd most viewed video on YouTube.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.promonews.tv/videos/2014/11/25/mark-ronson-ft-bruno-mars-uptown-funk-cameron-duddy-bruno-mars/30386) |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=www.promonews.tv}}</ref><ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web |title=2015 VMA Nominations: Get The Full List Now |url=https://www.mtv.com/news/t3unc6/2015-vma-nominations |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220803001839/https://www.mtv.com/news/t3unc6/2015-vma-nominations |url-status=dead |archive-date=August 3, 2022 |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=MTV |language=en}}</ref> He is the bass guitarist in the band [[Midland (band)|Midland]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nashcountrydaily.com/tag/cameron-duddy/|title=Cameron Duddy|website=Nash Country Daily|language=en-US|access-date=2020-04-01|archive-date=2020-01-09|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200109145151/http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/tag/cameron-duddy/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://buildingourownnashville.com/2018/11/16/interview-cameron-duddy-of-midland-discusses-cma-award-performance-other-band-names-the-uk-tour-and-more/|title=Interview: Cameron Duddy of Midland discusses CMA award performance, other band names, the UK tour and more|last=hannahjessica31|date=2018-11-16|website=Building Our Own Nashville|language=en|access-date=2020-04-01|archive-date=2020-09-26|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200926171923/https://buildingourownnashville.com/2018/11/16/interview-cameron-duddy-of-midland-discusses-cma-award-performance-other-band-names-the-uk-tour-and-more/|url-status=live}}</ref>

== Career ==

=== Music video director ===
Duddy has directed over 20 music videos, that include [[Mark Ronson]] and [[Bruno Mars]]' "[[Uptown Funk]]", [[Bruno Mars]]' "[[24K Magic (song)]]", and [[Fifth Harmony]]'s "[[Worth It (Fifth Harmony song)|Worth It]]".  In 2017, Cameron also directed Bruno Mars' "24K Magic" which has earned him a BET award<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bruno Mars And Zendaya Heat Up In The Video For 'Versace On The Floor' |url=https://www.bet.com/article/qljtlq/bruno-mars-and-zendaya-heat-up-in-versace-on-the-floor |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=BET |language=en}}</ref> and 3 VMA nominations for  "Best Video," "Best Director," and "Best Art Direction".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Willman |first=Chris |date=2017-08-26 |title=How a Country Music Bassist Made 'Magic' With Bruno Mars and Nabbed Four VMA Nominations |url=https://variety.com/2017/music/news/midland-bassist-video-director-vmas-bruno-mars-1202539414/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=Variety |language=en-US}}</ref> He has also worked with [[Fifth Harmony]],<ref name=":2" /> [[Jennifer Lopez]], [[Britney Spears]], [[Iggy Azalea]], <ref>{{Cite web |last=Houghton |first=Cillea |date=2023-10-31 |title=Cameron Duddy on Directing Britney Spears and Iggy Azalea's "Pretty Girls" Video: "They Were Both Dedicated" |url=https://americansongwriter.com/cameron-duddy-on-directing-britney-spears-and-iggy-azaleas-pretty-girls-video-they-were-both-dedicated/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=American Songwriter |language=en-US}}</ref> [[OneRepublic|One Republic]] and most recently received an [[MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Award]] for “Best Rock Video” for [[John Mayer|John Mayer’s]] single, [[Last Train Home (John Mayer song)|“Last Train Home”]]. <ref>{{Cite web |author1=Jackson Maxwell |date=2021-09-14 |title=John Mayer wins Best Rock Video at 2021 MTV VMAs |url=https://www.guitarworld.com/news/john-mayer-best-rock-video-vmas |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=guitarworld |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Legaspi |first=Althea |date=2021-06-04 |title=John Mayer Drops New 'Last Train Home' Video |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/john-mayer-last-train-home-song-video-1178382/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |magazine=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}}</ref> Duddy also received a [[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] nomination for "Best Group Video" for directing the debut single/video from his country trio, [[Midland (band)|Midland]]<ref>{{Cite web |last=Houghton |first=Cillea |date=2023-10-28 |title=Interview: Midland's Cameron Duddy Reflects on Directing Videos for Bruno Mars |url=https://americansongwriter.com/interview-midlands-cameron-duddy-reflects-on-directing-videos-for-bruno-mars/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=American Songwriter |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Musician/songwriter ===
Duddy is one of the founding members of the country music trio [[Midland (band)|Midland]].  Formed in 2016 in [[Dripping Springs, Texas]], it consists of [[Mark Wystrach]] (lead vocals), himself as bass guitarist and background vocalist, and Jess Carson (electric guitar, background vocals). Midland's musical styles and are defined by [[neotraditional country]] influences.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2017-03-03 |title=9 Important Things You Need To Know About Midland's Mark Wystrach, Jess Carson and Cameron Duddy |url=https://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2017/03/03/9-important-things-you-need-to-know-about-midlands-mark-wystrach-jess-carson-and-cameron-duddy/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190908142201/http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2017/03/03/9-important-things-you-need-to-know-about-midlands-mark-wystrach-jess-carson-and-cameron-duddy/ |archive-date=2019-09-08 |access-date=2020-04-01 |website=Nash Country Daily |language=en-US}}</ref> Through [[Big Machine Records]], Midland has released four full length LP’s, the first, [[On the Rocks (Midland album)|On The Rocks]],<ref>{{Cite web |last=Parry |first=Alex |date=2017-08-14 |title=Midland To Release Big Machine Records Debut 'On The Rocks' In September |url=https://musicrow.com/2017/08/midland-to-release-big-machine-records-debut-on-the-rocks-in-september/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=MusicRow.com |language=en-US}}</ref> which achieved Gold status and produced their triple platinum hit, ‘[[Drinkin' Problem|Drinkin Problem]]’<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kennedy |first=Michelle |date=2017-10-09 |title=Midland's Debut Album 'On The Rocks' Delivers Retro Sound, Storytelling Songs |url=https://www.thecountrynote.com/reviews/midlands-debut-album-rocks-delivers-retro-sound-storytelling-songs/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=The Country Note |language=en-US}}</ref> as well as a platinum hit, ‘[[Burn Out (Midland song)|Burn Out]]'.<ref>{{Cite web |title=MIDLAND TURNS "PROBLEMS" TO PLAQUES |url=https://hitsdailydouble.com/music_city&id=318189&title=MIDLAND-TURNS-PROBLEMS-TO-PLAQUES) |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=HITS Daily Double |language=en}}</ref> The album earned them two [[Grammy Awards|Grammy]] nominations<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lorton |first=Stacey |date=2018-01-23 |title=Midland Is Setting The World On Fire, And Racking Up Grammy Nominations While They're At It! |url=https://cowgirlmagazine.com/midland-grammy-nominations/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=COWGIRL Magazine |language=en-US}}</ref> and several [[Country Music Association Awards|CMA]],<ref>{{Cite web |last=Watts |first=Cindy |title=CMA Awards: Midland talks breakout success, announces Ryman show |url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2018/10/24/midland-cma-awards-ryman-auditorium-new-album/1727028002/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=The Tennessean |language=en-US}}</ref> [[Academy of Country Music Awards|ACM]]<ref>{{Cite web |date=2018-03-01 |title=2018 ACM Awards Nominations |url=https://www.acountry.com/2018-acm-awards-nominations/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=ACountry |language=en-US}}</ref> and [[CMT Music Awards|CMT]]<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Honeycutt |first=Shanté |date=2018-05-08 |title=CMT Music Awards 2018: See the Full List of Nominees |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/cmt-music-awards-2018-nominees-full-list-8455089/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}}</ref> nominations as well as a win for ‘Best New Group’ at the ACM Awards.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2018-03-26 |title=Watch Reba Call Lauren Alaina to Tell Her She Won ACM's New Female Vocalist of the Year |url=https://www.countryliving.com/life/entertainment/a19600788/acm-awards-best-new-artists-2018/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=Country Living |language=en-US}}</ref> The band most recently released their fourth album titled, [[The Last Resort: Greetings From]],<ref>{{Cite web |title=Country Trio Midland Says New Album The Last Resort: Greetings From 'Feels Like an Evolution of Sorts' |url=https://people.com/country/midland-release-the-last-resort-greetings-from-evolution-of-sorts/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref> leading Midland on a world tour with several sold out performances in AUS, Europe, and the US.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lane |first=Lexi |date=2022-05-10 |title=Midland Announces 'The Last Resort: Greetings From' Tour |url=https://www.udiscovermusic.com/news/midland-announces-the-last-resort-greetings-from-tour/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=uDiscover Music |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Skates |first=Sarah |date=2022-05-12 |title=Midland Expands 'The Last Resort: Greetings From Tour' |url=https://musicrow.com/2022/05/midland-expands-the-last-resort-greetings-from-tour/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=MusicRow.com |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Midland Announce 2023 Australia Tour {{!}} Holler |url=https://holler.country/news/midland-announce-2023-australia-tour |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=holler.country |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=by |date=2022-04-05 |title=Midland Announces Jonathan Terrell Will Open For Them on Tour |url=https://www.outsider.com/entertainment/music/midland-announces-jonathan-terrell-will-open-them-tour/ |access-date=2023-12-04 |website=Outsider |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Personal life ==
Duddy is the son of cinematographer Christopher Duddy and Renee Axotis. He is the stepson of actress [[Joely Fisher]], and also stepgrandson of actress [[Connie Stevens]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/celebrity/cameron-duddy-marries-harper-smith/|title=Cameron Duddy Marries Harper Smith|website=PEOPLE.com|language=EN|access-date=2020-04-01|archive-date=2021-01-12|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210112070757/https://people.com/celebrity/cameron-duddy-marries-harper-smith/|url-status=live}}</ref>

He is married to photographer Harper Smith. They have a son and a daughter. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.texasmonthly.com/style/midland-cameron-duddy-harper-smith-house/|title=Down on the Farm with Midland's Cameron Duddy and Photographer Harper Smith|last=|first=|date=23 July 2019|website=|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190723220823/https://www.texasmonthly.com/style/midland-cameron-duddy-harper-smith-house/ |archive-date=2019-07-23 |access-date=}}</ref>

== Nominations and awards ==
*2013: MTV Video Music Awards, Best Direction (''Locked Out of Heaven'')<ref name=":0" />
*2015/2017:  MTV Video Music Awards, Best Direction (nominee){{citation needed|date=April 2020}}
*2018: Grammy, Best Country Song (nominee)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/artists/cameron-duddy|title=Cameron Duddy|date=2019-11-19|website=GRAMMY.com|language=en|access-date=2020-04-01}}</ref>
